definitions.example: Don’t move that beam! It supports the whole platform.

definitions.definition: To answer questions and resolve problems regarding something sold.
definitions.example: Sure they sell the product, but do they support it?

definitions.definition: To back a cause, party, etc., mentally or with concrete aid.
definitions.example: I support France in the World Cup.
The government supports the arts in several ways.

definitions.definition: To verify; to make good; to substantiate; to establish; to sustain.
definitions.example: The evidence will not support the statements or allegations.

definitions.definition: To serve, as in a customer-oriented mindset; to give support to.
definitions.example: I don't make decisions, but I support those who do.

definitions.definition: To be designed (said of machinery, electronics, or computers, or their parts, accessories, peripherals, or programming) to function compatibly with or provide the capacity for.
definitions.example: Early personal computers did not support voice-recognition hardware or software.

definitions.definition: To be accountable for, or involved with, but not responsible for.
definitions.example: I support the administrative activities of the executive branch of the organization.

definitions.definition: To endure without being overcome; bear; undergo; to tolerate.
To assume and carry successfully, as the part of an actor; to represent or act; to sustain.
definitions.example: to support the character of King Lear

definitions.definition: That which supports something else; a support.
